com.qualcomm.hardware.bosch

Class JustLoggingAccelerationIntegrator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.qualcomm.hardware.bosch.JustLoggingAccelerationIntegrator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BNO055IMU.AccelerationIntegrator

    public class JustLoggingAccelerationIntegrator
extends java.lang.Object
implements BNO055IMU.AccelerationIntegrator
    JustLoggingAccelerationIntegrator is an integrator that doesn't actually integrate accelerations, but merely reports them in the logcat log. This is a debugging and demonstration tool, little more.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize(BNO055IMU.Parameters parameters,
                       Position initialPosition,
                       Velocity initialVelocity)
        Description copied from interface: BNO055IMU.AccelerationIntegrator
        (Re)initializes the algorithm with a starting position and velocity. Any timestamps that are present in these data are not to be considered as significant. The initial acceleration should be taken as undefined; you should set it to null when this method is called.
        Specified by:
        initialize in interface BNO055IMU.AccelerationIntegrator
        Parameters:
        parameters - configuration parameters for the IMU
        initialPosition - If non-null, the current sensor position is set to this value. If null, the current sensor position is unchanged.
        initialVelocity - If non-null, the current sensor velocity is set to this value. If null, the current sensor velocity is unchanged.
        See Also:
        BNO055IMU.AccelerationIntegrator.update(Acceleration)

        Description copied from interface: BNO055IMU.AccelerationIntegrator

      • getAcceleration

        public Acceleration getAcceleration()
        Description copied from interface: BNO055IMU.AccelerationIntegrator
        Returns the current acceleration as understood by the algorithm. This is typically just the value provided in the most recent call to BNO055IMU.AccelerationIntegrator.update(Acceleration), if any.
        Specified by:
        getAcceleration in interface BNO055IMU.AccelerationIntegrator
        Returns:
        the current acceleration, or null if the current position is undefined

      • update

        public void update(Acceleration linearAcceleration)
        Description copied from interface: BNO055IMU.AccelerationIntegrator
        Step the algorithm as a result of the stimulus of new acceleration data.
        Specified by:
        update in interface BNO055IMU.AccelerationIntegrator
        Parameters:
        linearAcceleration - the acceleration as just reported by the IMU
